attributes.additional_details:
All food, sweets and drinks, including alcohol, sold in the UK, with no exceptions, should be subject to compulsory food labelling.  This should be clearly shown for the total product weight, and also per 100g,  so that consumers can understand exactly what they are buying.

The labelling should contain the following information as a minimum:

Energy
Protein
Carbohydrates
Sugars
Total Fat
Saturates
Mono Unsaturates
Poly Unsaturates
Fibre
Sodium
Total Salt
Additives
Colours
Preservatives
